definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt

sentences.english: Al-Jadaa rebounded by selling her inventory and buying the equipment needed to start over.
sentences.chinese: 賈達通過變賣庫存重新購買設備才得以東山再起。

sentences.english: When the crash came, the family was forced to dispose of most of its possessions.
sentences.chinese: 家庭破落時，這家人只得變賣大部分家產。

sentences.english: You needs all your valuables to sell for that tax money.
sentences.chinese: 你需要變賣你所有有價值的東西去付稅金的。

sentences.english: Before going abroad, he realized all his property.
sentences.chinese: 在出國之前，他把他所有的財產統統變賣了。

sentences.english: The kid scavenged on the rubbish heap, trying to salvage something useful or valuable.
sentences.chinese: 這小孩子們在垃圾堆上搜尋着可以變賣的廢物。

sentences.english: I'll just have to sell up now to get some ready cash.
sentences.chinese: 我必須變賣家產才能得到現金。

sentences.english: Since I am in America, I can sell it in its entirety .
sentences.chinese: 因爲我在美國，所以就可將其完整地變賣出去。

sentences.english: How does Dorje Shugden protect the growth of spiritual realizations within our minds?
sentences.chinese: 多傑雄登是如何保護的生長在我們心中的精神變賣？

sentences.english: First, the man should sell the possessions that imprison him.
sentences.chinese: 首先，他要變賣一切捆縛他心靈的財物。

definition: to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
to pass on/to resell/to change hands
to owe a debt/the sum owed
